main event: An unidentified bright light, approximately 1/2 the size of the full moon, was observed making a direct approach toward the observers' location in Palm Beach, Florida on July 23, 1952.
interesting points: The object passed directly overhead at an estimated altitude of 2,000 feet.
After passing overhead, the object continued on a southwesterly course and made an abrupt turn to the south, accelerating in speed and disappearing from view in approximately 10 seconds.
The weather was clear with excellent visibility and a northeasterly wind of 10 knots.
Written statements from four observers and the pilot of an aircraft in the area at the time are included as enclosures.
Project Blue Book was unable to identify the object as any known aircraft or natural phenomenon, and the sighting was classified as 'UNIDENTIFIED'.
sighted object: a bright light, approximately 1/2 the size of the full moon
